abstract: Yahoo’s board is set to consider a deal to sell its holdings in Alibaba Group and its Japanese affiliate back to their majority holders in a complicated tax-free deal valued at about $17 billion, according to people briefed on the matter.
snippet: Yahoo’s board is set to consider a deal to sell its holdings in Alibaba Group and its Japanese affiliate back to their majority holders in a complicated tax-free deal valued at about $17 billion, according to people briefed on the matter.

headline.main: Yahoo to Consider Sale of Asian Assets

byline.original: By Evelyn M. Rusli and Michael J. de la Merced
